data.name: Covishield
data.description: The Oxford–AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, sold under the brand names Vaxzevria[4] and Covishield,[5] is a viral vector vaccine[6] produced by the British University of Oxford, British-Swedish company AstraZeneca, and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations.[6][7][8] Finland, Denmark and Norway suspended the use of the Oxford–AstraZeneca vaccine due to a small number of reports of a rare blood clot disorder.

data.name: Pfizer–BioNTech
data.description: The Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, sold under the brand name Comirnaty,[143] is an mRNA vaccine[144] produced by the German company BioNTech and the American company Pfizer.[144][145][146] In Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan, Comirnaty is distributed by Fosun Pharma

data.name: Janssen
data.description: The Janssen COVID-19 vaccine[242] is a viral vector vaccine[243] produced by Janssen Pharmaceutica (a subsidiary of Johnson & Johnson) and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.[244][245] It is also known as Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 Vaccine and as COVID-19 Vaccine Janssen.

data.name: Moderna
data.description: The Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, also known as Spikevax,[296] is an mRNA vaccine[297] produced by the American company Moderna, the U.S. National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, the U.S. Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority, and the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations.

data.name: Sinopharm BIBP
data.description: The Sinopharm BIBP COVID-19 vaccine is an inactivated virus vaccine produced by the China National Pharmaceutical Group (Sinopharm) and its Beijing Institute of Biological Products.

data.name: Sputnik V
data.description: The Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine is a viral vector vaccine[475] produced by the Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology.

data.name: CoronaVac
data.description: The CoronaVac COVID-19 vaccine is an inactivated virus vaccine[560] produced by the Chinese company Sinovac Biotech.[560][561][562]

data.name: Covaxin
data.description: Covaxin is an inactivated virus vaccine produced by the Indian company Bharat Biotech in collaboration with the Indian Council of Medical Research–National Institute of Virology.

data.name: Sputnik Light
data.description: Sputnik Light is a viral vector vaccine,[643] produced by the Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology. It consists of the first dose of the Sputnik V vaccine, which is based on the Ad26 vector.[644]

data.name: Convidecia
data.description: Convidecia is a viral vector vaccine[667] produced by the Chinese company CanSino Biologics and the Beijing Institute of Biotechnology of the Academy of Military Medical Sciences.

data.name: QazCovid-in
data.description: QazCovid-in, also known as QazVac, is an inactivated virus vaccine developed by the Research Institute for Biological Safety Problems in Kazakhstan.
